events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred on April 30, involving a rear-end collision at a stoplight.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to clear involvement of a vehicle collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to support the customer throughout the auto accident claim process.
The customer received official acknowledgment of the auto accident claim, ensuring their report is under review.
The insurer requested accident reports, vehicle photos, and police documentation to proceed with the claim investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos of vehicle damage and a police collision report.
The investigation into circumstances of the auto accident began with review of submitted documentation and witness statements.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant was not at fault; damage to customer's vehicle assessed thoroughly.
A fair settlement offer was proposed covering vehicle repairs and rental car expenses during repair period.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, grateful for the prompt and professional handling.
The claim was officially approved, authorizing release of funds for vehicle repairs and related costs.
Insurance payment for repairs and rental car coverage was issued to the customer promptly following claim approval.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and customer satisfaction confirmed.
All documents and communications related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
